text: Austin Lane Crothers was an American Democratic Party politician who served as governor of Maryland from 1908 to 1912. During Crother’s tenure, various reforms were carried out such as the establishment of a public service commissionEncyclopedia of Maryland by Nancy Capace, 1999, P.58 and various labor laws. Title: November 1909 : Bulletin of the United States Bureau of Labor, No. 85, Volume XIX, P.611-612Title: November 1910 : Bulletin of the United States Bureau of Labor, No. 91, Volume XXI, P.1063-1072 According to one study, Crothers was credited “with accomplishing more in terms of Progressive legislation than any previous governor.”Governors and the Progressive Movement by David R. Berman, 2019, P.144 ==References== Category:Governors of Maryland Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Progressive Era
title: Austin Lane Crothers
